byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Pres Obama announces the deployment of 100 armed military advisers to central Africa to help regional forces combat the Lord's Resistance Army, notorious renegade group that originated as a Ugandan rebel group in the 1980s and has morphed into a marauding cultlike group of killers and rapists.
snippet: President Obama said the deployment to Africa was meant to help regional forces combat the Lord’s Resistance Army, which has terrorized villagers in at least four countries.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: President Obama said the deployment to Africa was meant to help regional forces combat the Lord’s Resistance Army, which has terrorized villagers in at least four countries.

headline.main: Armed U.S. Advisers to Help Fight African Renegade Group
headline.print_headline: Armed U.S. Advisers to Help Fight African Renegade Group
headline.seo: U.S. Advisers to Aid in Fight Against Lord’s Resistance Army
